column3: $Mike Crudale's first pitch was high and tight, causing a reaction from Kenny Lofton; both benches cleared with much pushing and shoving; managers Tony LaRussa and Dusty Baker go after each other and are separated; the pitch apparently was retalation for Lofton's perceived showboating after his 3rd inning homer; no ejections; both sides warned
$everyone safe when Fernando Vina failed to cover 2B; he relayed to 1B too late to get Benito Santiago
$Miguel Cairo called for obstruction but 3B umpire Jeff Nelson ruled Benito Santiago would not have scored so 'remedy' is to award him 3B; no error on play because no advance
$Edgar Renteria thought dribbler was foul, did not run
$after David Bell scored the Series-winning run, Kenny Lofton taunted the Cardinals' players in the dugout as a reaction to the inside pitch and comments in game 1
